Description: Amuletic string: a string of disc beads of bright-blue glazed composition, one long cylindrical bead of green glazed composition and two amulets, both of glazed composition. The blue amulet resembles a fist (Brunton's 8W3), while the green one is a debased Ptah-Sokar figure.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Register and Diary of D.G. Hogarth's excavations at Asyut, 1907, and Report to the Trustees of the British Museum, all in MSS.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (263)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr David George Hogarth
